MultiFeature.Name: Revenant Blade
MultiFeature.Text: You are descended from a master of the double blade and their skills have passed on to you. You gain the following benefits: • Increase your Dexterity or Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20. • While wielding a double-bladed weapon with two hands, the weapon has the finesse trait for your attacks with it, and you gain +1 AC. • On your turn, when you use a bonus action to make a melee attack with the blade at the opposite end of the weapon, the weapon’s damage die for this attack increases to 2d4, instead of 1d4.

ChoiceFeature.Name: Ability Score Increase
ChoiceFeature.Text: Increase your Dexterity or Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

AbilityScoreFeature.Name: Dexterity
AbilityScoreFeature.Text: Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

AbilityScoreFeature.Name: Strength
AbilityScoreFeature.Text: Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

BonusFeature.Name: Revenant Blade
BonusFeature.Text: While wielding a double-bladed weapon with two hands, the weapon has the finesse trait for your attacks with it, and you gain +1 AC.

Feature.Name: Revenant Blade
Feature.Text: On your turn, when you use a bonus action to make a melee attack with the blade at the opposite end of the weapon, the weapon’s damage die for this attack increases to 2d4, instead of 1d4.

ChoiceFeature.Name: Greater Dragonmark
ChoiceFeature.Text:
Your dragonmark has grown in size and power. This enhances your existing dragonmark, and the benefits are based on the mark that you already possess. A greater dragonmark provides the following benefits: • The die type of your dragonmarked Intuition Die increases by one (for example, from a d4 to a d6). • Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. The abilities available to you are based on your mark, as shown on the Greater Dragonmark Benefits table. • You learn a set of spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot or using a material component. The list of spells, the spellcasting ability for them, and the type of rest you must complete to regain the use of these spells are shown on the Greater Dragonmark Benefits table. To cast Leomund’s secret chest using this feat and the Mark of Warding, you must have a Siberys dragonshard with a value of at least 100 gp. While you have this dragonshard in hand, it serves as the spell’s focus, and you can use it to summon and dismiss the chest.
Detection – Charisma or Intelligence – See Invisibilty, True Seeing – Intelligence – Long Finding – Dexterity, Strength, or Wisdom – Locate Creature, Find the Path – Wisdom – Long Handling – Dexterity or Wisdom – Beast Sense, Dominate Beast – Wisdom – Long Healing – Dexterity or Wisdom – Mass Healing Word, Greater Restoration – Wisdom – Long Hospitality – Charisma or Dexterity – Sanctuary, Mordenkainen’s Magnificent Mansion – Charisma – Long Making – Dexterity or Intelligence – Fabricate, Creation – Intelligence – Long Passage – Dexterity or Constitution – Blink, Teleportation Circle – Constitution – Long Scribing – Intelligence or Charisma – Sending, Tongues – Intelligence – Long or Short Sentinel – Strength or Wisdom – Compel Duel, Warding Bond – Wisdom – Long or Short Shadow – Charisma or Dexterity – Nondetection, Mislead – Charisma – Long Storm – Charisma or Dexterity – Control Water, Control Wind – Charisma – Long Warding – Dexterity or Intelligence – Knock, Glyph of Warding, Leomund’s Secret Chest* -- Intelligence – Long
ChoiceFeature.Prerequisite: 8th level, character must possess a dragonmark

MultiFeature.Name: Detection
MultiFeature.Text: Charisma or Intelligence – See Invisibilty, True Seeing – Intelligence – Long

Feature.Name: Greater Dragonmark
Feature.Text: The die type of your dragonmarked Intuition Die increases by one (for example, from a d4 to a d6).

ChoiceFeature.Name: Ability Score Increase
ChoiceFeature.Text: The abilities available to you are based on your mark, as shown on the Greater Dragonmark Benefits table.

AbilityScoreFeature.Name: Charisma
AbilityScoreFeature.Text: Your Charisma score increases score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

AbilityScoreFeature.Name: Intelligence
AbilityScoreFeature.Text: Your Intelligence score increases score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

BonusSpellFeature.Name: Greater Dragonmark Spell
BonusSpellFeature.Text: You learn the see invisibility spell. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell. Once you cast it you regain the ability to do so once you finish a long rest.

BonusSpellFeature.Name: Greater Dragonmark Spell
BonusSpellFeature.Text: You learn the true seeing spell. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell. Once you cast it you regain the ability to do so once you finish a long rest.

Feature.Name: Greater Dragonmark
Feature.Text: You learn the see invisibility and the true seeing spells. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. Once you cast a spell using this trait you regain the ability to do so once you finish a long rest.

MultiFeature.Name: Warding
MultiFeature.Text: Dexterity or Intelligence – Knock, Glyph of Warding, Leomund’s Secret Chest* -- Intelligence – Long To cast Leomund’s secret chest using this feat and the Mark of Warding, you must have a Siberys dragonshard with a value of at least 100 gp. While you have this dragonshard in hand, it serves as the spell’s focus, and you can use it to summon and dismiss the chest.

BonusSpellFeature.Name: Greater Dragonmark Spell
BonusSpellFeature.Text: You learn the glyph of warding spell. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell. Once you cast it you regain the ability to do so once you finish a long rest.

BonusSpellFeature.Name: Greater Dragonmark Spell
BonusSpellFeature.Text: You learn the Leomund's secret chest spell. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell. Once you cast it you regain the ability to do so once you finish a long rest. To cast Leomund’s secret chest using this feat and the Mark of Warding, you must have a Siberys dragonshard with a value of at least 100 gp. While you have this dragonshard in hand, it serves as the spell’s focus, and you can use it to summon and dismiss the chest.

Feature.Name: Greater Dragonmark
Feature.Text: You learn the knock, glyph of warding and Leomund's secret chest spells. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. Once you cast a spell using this trait you regain the ability to do so once you finish a long rest. To cast Leomund’s secret chest using this feat and the Mark of Warding, you must have a Siberys dragonshard with a value of at least 100 gp. While you have this dragonshard in hand, it serves as the spell’s focus, and you can use it to summon and dismiss the chest.

MultiFeature.Name: Aberrant Dragonmark
MultiFeature.Text: You have manifested an aberrant dragonmark. Determine its appearance and the flaw associated with it. You gain the following benefits: • Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20. • You learn a cantrip from the sorcerer spell list. In addition, choose a 1st-level spell from the sorcerer spell list. You learn that spell and can cast it at its lowest level. Once you cast it, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it again. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells. • You can increase the power of your aberrant spells at the risk of your own vitality. When you cast a spell with your aberrant mark, you can use one of your Hit Dice to increase the spell’s level by 1. Immediately after you cast the spell, roll the Hit Die. You take damage equal to the number rolled.

AbilityScoreFeature.Name: Ability Score Increase
AbilityScoreFeature.Text: Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Feature.Name: Aberrent Dragonmark
Feature.Text: You learn a cantrip from the sorcerer spell list. In addition, choose a 1st-level spell from the sorcerer spell list. You learn that spell and can cast it at its lowest level. Once you cast it, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it again. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

BonusSpellKeywordChoiceFeature.Name: Aberrant Dragonmark
BonusSpellKeywordChoiceFeature.Text: You learn a cantrip from the sorcerer spell list. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

BonusSpellKeywordChoiceFeature.Name: Aberrant Dragonmark
BonusSpellKeywordChoiceFeature.Text: Choose a 1st-level spell from the sorcerer spell list. You learn that spell and can cast it at its lowest level. Once you cast it, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it again. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

SpellModifyFeature.Name: Aberrant Dragonmark
SpellModifyFeature.Text: You can increase the power of your aberrant spells at the risk of your own vitality. When you cast a spell with your aberrant mark, you can use one of your Hit Dice to increase the spell’s level by 1. Immediately after you cast the spell, roll the Hit Die. You take damage equal to the number rolled.
